judges: Before Steen, C. J., Steabne, Jones, Bell, Chidsey, Musmanno and Abnold, JJ.

opinions.text:
Opinion
Per Curiam,
The decree of the court below dismissing the bill of complaint is affirmed at the appellants’ costs on the opinion of President Judge Kun, reported at 2 D. & C. 2d 181, which adequately disposed of the matter.
opinions.author: Per Curiam,

attorneys: Thomas Raeburn White, with him Warren D. Mulloy, G. L. Gushmore, Jr. and White, Williams & Scott, for appellants.
Harvey Levin, Deputy to the City Solicitor, and Abraham L. Freedman, City Solicitor, for appellees.
Joseph E. Gold, with Mm Lenard L. Wolffe, Samuel Smith and Gilbert Stein, for appellee.
Harry F. Stambaugh, Special Counsel, with him Herbert B. Oohen, Attorney General, for the Commonwealth of Pennsylvania, appellee.
casebody.head_matter:
Krull, Appellant, v. Philadelphia.
Argued May 3, 1955.
Before Steen, C. J., Steabne, Jones, Bell, Chidsey, Musmanno and Abnold, JJ.
Thomas Raeburn White, with him Warren D. Mulloy, G. L. Gushmore, Jr. and White, Williams & Scott, for appellants.
May 23, 1955:
Harvey Levin, Deputy to the City Solicitor, and Abraham L. Freedman, City Solicitor, for appellees.
Joseph E. Gold, with Mm Lenard L. Wolffe, Samuel Smith and Gilbert Stein, for appellee.
Harry F. Stambaugh, Special Counsel, with him Herbert B. Oohen, Attorney General, for the Commonwealth of Pennsylvania, appellee.
